Description: A figure of a crouching lion in ivory: intended for use as a gaming-piece, originally carved with great detail but now in rather poor condition. The front paws are missing, as is the side of the head, and the surface of the ivory has decayed. The features still visible include the eyes and details of the mane, as well as the slightly open mouth, in which the teeth are delineated. The detail is only preserved in a small area beneath the chin and also beside the surviving ear. The underside of the lion is worn smooth from use.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Abydos, Tomb S548. This grave belongs to the Merneit valley cemetery.
